p: A Tongan population of A. vexans was shown to be able to transmit RRV despite poor susceptibility [39] and an Italian population of the species was demonstrated to be susceptible to CHIKV [40]. Recently, experimental infections in wild-caught American mosquitoes showed moderate to high susceptibility to ZIKV and low ability to transmit the virus [41], [42]. The authors also highlighted the importance of field factors, arguing that high mosquito population densities may counterbalance weak vector competence. In FP, the current distribution and abundance of A. vexans are not known and its propagation is not monitored. The role of A. vexans as a potential vector at risk for arboviruses in FP is especially important because the adults are known to be able to fly long distances [36], [43].
